summary: An email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York to their team, dated March 19, 2021, proposing the FBI reach out to three potential witnesses in the Epstein case. The witnesses include a former Interlochen VP who managed the Epstein relationship, a former gardener at Epstein's Palm Beach residence, and a third unspecified individual.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: Author of the email, proposing the FBI contact three potential witnesses for the Epstein case.

events.title: Proposal to Contact Witnesses
events.description: An AUSA proposes the FBI reach out to three potential witnesses, including a former Interlochen VP and a former gardener at Epstein's Palm Beach residence.
personsInvolved: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York

keyFacts: Prosecutors were actively seeking to interview witnesses as of March 2021.
A former Vice President of Interlochen who managed the institution's relationship with Epstein was a person of interest.
A former gardener at Epstein's Palm Beach residence was a person of interest, as he reportedly told the FBI he believed someone 'knew about the sexualized massages'.
The email indicates a prior hold was placed on contacting one of the three proposed witnesses, but the author believed it was 'probably time to go ahead'.
